title: The Things you do for a beer

abstract: "We would do bloody anything to get in the army."
description: When World War II broke out, some men would do anything to sign up and when the war was over, most men would do anything for a beer. Steve Whelan came from a family of servicemen and was eager to do his bit. He tells the story of how he and a group of fellow prisoners of war found a way to escape and find a beer.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2002683; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Morwell veterans]; Active; 2011
